add_items_to_a_release.name: add_items_to_a_release
add_items_to_a_release.description: This tool programmatically adds specified content items to a designated release within a Contentstack stack branch by accepting structured item data in JSON format, enabling automated release management and deployment workflows.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

release_id.description: Select a release in which you want to add the items.

item_data.description: Enter the data to be added in JSON format.

assign_reassign_a_branch_alias.name: assign_reassign_a_branch_alias
assign_reassign_a_branch_alias.description: This tool assigns or reassigns a branch alias within a stack, enabling branch identification and routing. It requires specifying the alias identifier, the target branch, and the assignment action.

assign_action.description: Select an action to assign/reassign an existing/new alias to a branch.

branch_alias_id.description: Select an alias to assign to a branch. If you select Assign, make sure to manually enter the new alias name before assigning it to the branch.

target_branch.description: Select the target branch to which you want to assign or reassign an alias.

clone_a_release.name: clone_a_release
clone_a_release.description: This tool creates a duplicate of an existing release in the specified branch, assigning a new name and optional description to the cloned release. Release management, cloning.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

release_id.description: Select a release you want to clone.

name.description: Enter a suitable name for the cloned release.

description.description: Enter a suitable description for the cloned release.

create_an_asset.name: create_an_asset
create_an_asset.description: This tool creates a new asset in the specified stack branch by uploading a file from a provided URL, assigning a title, file name, and optional description, and saving it to a designated folder. Keywords: asset creation, file upload.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

title.description: Specify a title for the asset.

key.description: Specify a file name for the asset.

body.description: Specify an input URL to create an asset.

description.description: Specify a description for the asset.

folder_id.description: Select a destination folder for saving the created asset.

create_a_branch.name: create_a_branch
create_a_branch.description: This tool creates a new branch within a specified stack by duplicating all content types, entries, and assets from the designated source branch. Branch management, stack operations.

source_branch.description: Select a source branch from your stack. This retrieves all the associated content types, entries, and assets from the source branch, then creates a new branch.

branch_uid.description: Specify a UID to create a branch. Ensure it is  lowercase, has no space, and is maximum 15 characters.

create_an_entry.name: create_an_entry
create_an_entry.description: This tool creates a new entry in the specified Contentstack stack, targeting the defined branch, content type, and locale. Entry data must be encapsulated within an 'entry' object. Suitable for automated content creation workflows. Keywords: entry creation, content type.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to create an entry.

entry_data.description: The fields should be wrapped by an entry object {'entry':{...data}}

locale.description: Select a locale in which you want to create the entry.

localize_an_entry.name: localize_an_entry
localize_an_entry.description: This tool localizes a specified entry within a stack by creating or updating its content for the target locale, ensuring the entry becomes independent from the fallback locale. Supports branch selection, content type, entry identification, and locale specification. Localization, entry management.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to localize the entry.

entry_id.description: Select an entry that you want to localize.

locale.description: Select a locale (language) in which you want to localize the entry.

entry_data.description: The fields should be wrapped by an entry object {'entry':{...data}}

create_a_release.name: create_a_release
create_a_release.description: This tool creates a new empty release object within the specified stack branch, initializing it with a required name and optional description; supports branch selection and inclusion parameters for release management.

name.description: Enter a suitable name for the release.

description.description: Enter a suitable description for the release.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

create_a_taxonomy.name: create_a_taxonomy
create_a_taxonomy.description: This tool creates a new taxonomy object within the specified stack, assigning the provided UID, name, and optional description for structured content classification. Keywords: taxonomy, stack

taxonomy_data.description: Must be { taxonomy: { uid, name, description } }

create_a_term.name: create_a_term
create_a_term.description: This tool creates a new term within a specified taxonomy by assigning a unique identifier, name, order, and optional parent term. Taxonomy, term creation.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to create a term.

uid.description: Specify a UID to create a term.

name.description: Specify a title for the term. It must contain only alphanumeric values and underscores.

order.description: Specify the placement order of your term.

parent_uid.description: Select the parent to create a term.

delete_a_branch_alias.name: delete_a_branch_alias
delete_a_branch_alias.description: This tool deletes the specified branch alias from the target stack, removing the alias reference and disassociating it from all related branches.

branch_alias_id.description: Select a branch alias to delete.

delete_an_asset.name: delete_an_asset
delete_an_asset.description: This tool permanently deletes the specified asset from the selected branch within the stack. Asset management, deletion

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

delete_a_branch.name: delete_a_branch
delete_a_branch.description: This tool deletes a specified branch within a stack, permanently removing all associated content types and assets. Keywords: branch deletion, stack management.

branch_id.description: Select a branch to delete. This deletes all the content types and assets in the branch.

delete_an_entry.name: delete_an_entry
delete_an_entry.description: This tool permanently deletes a specified entry from a given content type within a stack, supporting branch, locale, and localized entry deletion options. Keywords: entry deletion, content type

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to delete the entry from the stack.

locales.description: Select the locale(s) to delete the entry in that locale.

delete_a_taxonomy.name: delete_a_taxonomy
delete_a_taxonomy.description: This tool deletes the specified taxonomy and all associated terms from the stack.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to delete. This deletes all the associated terms within the selected taxonomy.

delete_a_term.name: delete_a_term
delete_a_term.description: This tool deletes a specified term from a taxonomy using the provided taxonomy_uid and term_uid parameters; supports forced deletion via the force flag. Keywords: taxonomy, term deletion.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to delete a term.

deploy_a_release.name: deploy_a_release
deploy_a_release.description: This tool deploys a specified release to one or more target environments within a Contentstack stack, supporting branch selection and optional scheduling for automated release publishing. Keywords: release deployment, environment.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

release_id.description: Select a release you want to deploy.

environments.description: Select the environment(s) in which you want to perform the release deploy action.

scheduled_at.description: Schedule the release publish in “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS” format.

export_a_taxonomy.name: export_a_taxonomy
export_a_taxonomy.description: This tool exports a taxonomy and all its associated terms from the specified stack in the selected format, supporting structured data extraction for taxonomy management.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy you want to export. This exports all the associated terms within the selected taxonomy.

format.description: Select the format in which you want to export the taxonomy.

get_all_languages.name: get_all_languages
get_all_languages.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all languages configured within a specified stack branch, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters. Localization, language management.

limit.description: Specify the number of languages to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then the first 10 languages will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of languages to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three languages will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

get_all_branch_aliases.name: get_all_branch_aliases
get_all_branch_aliases.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all branch aliases within a specified stack, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters. Keywords: branch aliases, stack.

limit.description: Specify the number of branch aliases to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then 10 branch aliases will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of branch aliases to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three branch aliases will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

get_all_assets.name: get_all_assets
get_all_assets.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all assets within a specified stack, supporting environment and branch filters, with pagination via limit and skip parameters. Keywords: asset retrieval, metadata.

environment.description: Select an environment to fetch the asset details.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

limit.description: Specify the number of assets to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then 10 assets will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of assets to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three assets will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

folder_id.description: Select a folder to fetch the details of all the assets in that folder.

get_all_branches.name: get_all_branches
get_all_branches.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all branches within a specified stack, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters. Keywords: branches, stack

limit.description: Specify the number of branches to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then the first 10 branches will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of branches to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three branches will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

get_all_entries.name: get_all_entries
get_all_entries.description: This tool retrieves all entries for a specified content type within a stack branch, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters. Keywords: entries, content type.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Configure this option to fetch entries of a particular content type.

limit.description: Specify the number of entries to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then 10 entries will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of entries to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three entries will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

version.description: Specify the version to fetch the entries saved in that version.

locale.description: Specify the locale to fetch the localized entries.

get_all_global_fields.name: get_all_global_fields
get_all_global_fields.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all global fields configured within the specified stack, supporting optional branch selection and branch metadata inclusion.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

get_all_items_in_a_release.name: get_all_items_in_a_release
get_all_items_in_a_release.description: This tool retrieves metadata and content details for all items associated with the specified release_id, optionally including branch information if include_branch is true.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

release_id.description: Select a release from which you want to fetch the item details.

get_all_releases.name: get_all_releases
get_all_releases.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all releases within a specified stack, supporting branch selection, pagination via limit and skip parameters, and optional inclusion of total and item counts. Keywords: releases, metadata

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

limit.description: Specify the number of releases to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then 10 releases will be fetched.

skip.description: Specify the number of releases to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three releases will be skipped.

get_all_taxonomies.name: get_all_taxonomies
get_all_taxonomies.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all taxonomies within a specified stack, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters, and enabling filtered search by UID or name. Keywords: taxonomy, pagination

limit.description: Specify the number of taxonomies to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then the first 10 taxonomies will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of taxonomies to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three taxonomies will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

typeahead.description: Specify a UID or name to search the taxonomies.

get_all_terms.name: get_all_terms
get_all_terms.description: This tool retrieves all term details for a specified taxonomy from the stack, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters. Keywords: taxonomy, terms.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to fetch the details of all the terms.

limit.description: Specify the number of terms to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then the first 10 terms will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of terms to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three terms will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

typeahead.description: Specify a UID or name to search the term(s).

depth.description: Specify the depth to fetch the terms from the root level. By default, the terms are fetched from the root.

get_all_terms_across_all_taxonomies.name: get_all_terms_across_all_taxonomies
get_all_terms_across_all_taxonomies.description: This tool retrieves term details from all taxonomies within the stack, supporting typeahead search, pagination via limit and skip, and optional total count inclusion. Keywords: taxonomy, term.

typeahead.description: Specify a UID or name to search the term(s).

limit.description: Specify the number of terms to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then the first 10 terms will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of terms to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three terms will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

get_all_variants_of_an_entry.name: get_all_variants_of_an_entry
get_all_variants_of_an_entry.description: This tool retrieves all locale variants of a specified entry within the selected content type, enabling access to localized entry data for further processing or analysis.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to fetch the details of all the variants of an entry.

entry_uid.description: Select an entry to fetch the details of its variants.

get_all_ancestors_of_a_term.name: get_all_ancestors_of_a_term
get_all_ancestors_of_a_term.description: This tool retrieves the complete ancestor hierarchy for a specified term within a taxonomy, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters. Keywords: taxonomy, hierarchy.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to fetch the details of all the terms.

term_uid.description: Select a term to fetch its ancestors.

limit.description: Specify the number of terms to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then the first 10 terms will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of terms to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three terms will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

get_a_single_asset.name: get_a_single_asset
get_a_single_asset.description: This tool retrieves metadata and properties for a specified asset within a Contentstack stack, supporting branch, environment, and version parameters for precise asset identification and retrieval. Keywords: asset, metadata

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

asset_id.description: Select an asset to fetch its details.

environment.description: Select an environment to fetch the asset details.

version.description: Enter the asset version to fetch its details.

get_asset_reference.name: get_asset_reference
get_asset_reference.description: This tool retrieves all entries referencing the specified asset within the selected branch, enabling asset dependency analysis and content relationship management.

asset_id.description: Select an asset to view all entries where it is referenced.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

get_a_single_branch.name: get_a_single_branch
get_a_single_branch.description: This tool retrieves metadata and configuration details for a specified branch within a Contentstack stack, enabling branch-level inspection and management.

Branch_id.description: Select a branch to fetch its details.

get_all_content_types.name: get_all_content_types
get_all_content_types.description: This tool retrieves metadata for all content types within the specified stack branch, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters, and optional filtering using key-value query pairs. Keywords: content types, metadata

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

limit.description: Specify the number of content types to fetch from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then 10 content types will be fetched.

skip.description: Specify the number of content types to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three content types will be skipped.

get_all_descendants_of_a_term.name: get_all_descendants_of_a_term
get_all_descendants_of_a_term.description: This tool retrieves all descendant terms of a specified taxonomy term, supporting pagination via limit and skip parameters. Suitable for hierarchical taxonomy traversal and term management.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to fetch the details of all the terms.

term_uid.description: Select a term to fetch its descendants.

limit.description: Specify the number of terms to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then the first 10 terms will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of terms to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three terms will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

depth.description: Specify the depth to fetch the descendants of a term.

get_single_entry.name: get_single_entry
get_single_entry.description: This tool retrieves metadata and field values for a single entry from a specified content type, branch, and locale within a Contentstack stack. Supports version selection and optional inclusion of workflow details. Keywords: entry retrieval, metadata.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to fetch the entry details.

entry_id.description: Select an entry to fetch its details.

locale.description: Select a locale to fetch the entry details in that locale.

get_a_single_merge_job.name: get_a_single_merge_job
get_a_single_merge_job.description: This tool retrieves detailed information for a specified merge job within a stack, using the provided merge_job_uid parameter. Keywords: merge job, stack.

merge_job_uid.description: Select a merge job to fetch its details.

get_a_single_release.name: get_a_single_release
get_a_single_release.description: This tool retrieves metadata and configuration details for a specified release within a given branch, supporting optional inclusion of branch information for developer reference and audit purposes.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

release_id.description: Select a release to fetch its details.

get_a_single_branch_alias.name: get_a_single_branch_alias
get_a_single_branch_alias.description: This tool retrieves metadata and configuration details for a specified branch alias within a Contentstack stack, enabling branch management and validation operations.

branch_alias_id.description: Select a branch alias to fetch its details.

get_a_single_content_type.name: get_a_single_content_type
get_a_single_content_type.description: This tool retrieves the schema and configuration details of a specified content type within a Contentstack stack, supporting options to include global field definitions and branch metadata.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to fetch its details.

get_single_entry_variant.name: get_single_entry_variant
get_single_entry_variant.description: This tool retrieves a specific variant of a content entry from a designated content type, branch, and locale, using the provided entry and variant identifiers. Suitable for variant management and localization workflows.

variant_group_uid.description: Select the Variant Group from which you want to fetch the details of a single variant entry.

variant_uid.description: Select a variant to fetch its details.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

get_a_single_global_field.name: get_a_single_global_field
get_a_single_global_field.description: This tool retrieves metadata and configuration details for a specified global field within a Contentstack stack, supporting branch selection and optional inclusion of branch context. Keywords: global field, metadata

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

global_field_uid.description: Select a global field to fetch its details.

get_a_single_variant.name: get_a_single_variant
get_a_single_variant.description: This tool retrieves detailed information for a specified variant within a designated Variant Group using the provided variant_id and variant_group_uid parameters. Keywords: variant, retrieval

variant_group_uid.description: Select the Variant Group from which you want to fetch the details of a single variant.

variant_id.description: Select a variant to fetch its details.

get_a_single_taxonomy.name: get_a_single_taxonomy
get_a_single_taxonomy.description: This tool retrieves metadata and configuration details for a specified taxonomy, with optional inclusion of term, referenced term, and referenced entry counts for advanced content modeling and reporting.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to fetch its details.

get_a_single_term.name: get_a_single_term
get_a_single_term.description: This tool retrieves detailed metadata for a specified taxonomy term, supporting optional inclusion of child term and referenced entry counts.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to fetch the details of a single term.

term_uid.description: Select a term to fetch its details.

get_user_information.name: get_user_information
get_user_information.description: This tool retrieves detailed information for the specified user ID from the Contentstack stack, supporting user management and audit operations.

user_ids.description: Enter a user ID to fetch the details.

get_all_variants_of_a_content_type.name: get_all_variants_of_a_content_type
get_all_variants_of_a_content_type.description: This tool retrieves all variant definitions linked to the specified content type, enabling programmatic access to variant metadata for content modeling and management.

content_type_uid.description: Select a content type to fetch all the variants associated with it.

import_a_taxonomy.name: import_a_taxonomy
import_a_taxonomy.description: This tool imports a taxonomy and its associated terms into the target stack using the specified data format and payload.

format.description: Select the format in which you want to import the taxonomy.

body.description: Specify the data in JSON or CSV format to import.

merge_branch.name: merge_branch
merge_branch.description: This tool merges content types and global fields from the specified compare (source) branch into the designated base (target) branch using the selected merge strategy.

compare_branch.description: Select a compare (source) branch to copy the content types and global fields.

base_branch.description: Select a base (target) branch in which you want to merge the data from the compare branch.

merge_strategy.description: Select a merge strategy to merge the branch.

merge_comment.description: Specify additional descriptive comment(s) for the merge action. The specified comments can be fetched via the ‘Get a Single Merge Job’ action for future reference.

publish_an_asset.name: publish_an_asset
publish_an_asset.description: This tool publishes a specified asset from a selected branch to one or more environments and locales within a stack, with optional scheduling for future deployment. Keywords: asset publishing, environment.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

environments.description: Select the environment(s) in which you want to publish the asset.

locales.description: Select the locale(s) in which you want to publish the asset.

scheduled_at.description: Schedule the asset publish in ‘YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS’ format.

publish_an_entry.name: publish_an_entry
publish_an_entry.description: This tool publishes a specified entry from a selected content type to one or more environments and locales within a designated branch of the stack. Content publishing, environments

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to publish the entry.

locales.description: Select the locale(s) in which you want to publish the entry.

environments.description: Select the environment(s) in which you want to publish the entry.

scheduled_at.description: Schedule the entry publish in ‘YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS’ format.

get_publish_queue.name: get_publish_queue
get_publish_queue.description: This tool retrieves metadata and content for all entries, both published and unpublished, within a specified stack branch, supporting query filtering, pagination, and branch selection.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

limit.description: Specify the number of entries to retrieve from the stack. For example, if you set the limit to 10, then 10 entries will be fetched. The maximum limit is 100.

skip.description: Specify the number of entries to skip. For example, if you set the skip value to 3, the first three entries will be skipped and the results will start with the fourth item.

publish_variants_of_an_entry.name: publish_variants_of_an_entry
publish_variants_of_an_entry.description: This tool publishes specified entry variants to selected environments and locales within a defined branch, supporting variant group targeting for content type entries. Keywords: publish, variants

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to publish the entry’s variant.

entry.description: Select an entry to publish its variant.

variant_group_uid.description: Select the Variant Group to publish the variant.

variant_ids.description: Select the variant(s) to publish its content. You can select multiple variants.

locales.description: Select the locale(s) in which you want to publish the entry’s variant. You can select multiple locales.

environments.description: Select the environment(s) in which you want to publish the entry’s variant. You can select multiple environments.

scheduled_at.description: Schedule the publish schedule in ‘YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS’ format.

delete_items_from_a_release.name: delete_items_from_a_release
delete_items_from_a_release.description: This tool programmatically removes specified content items from a designated release within a Contentstack stack branch, requiring the release identifier and item data in JSON format for precise targeting and execution.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

release_id.description: Select a release from which you want to remove an item.

item_data.description: Enter the item data in JSON format.

set_entry_workflow.name: set_entry_workflow
set_entry_workflow.description: This tool assigns a specified workflow stage to a content entry within a defined branch and content type in a Contentstack stack. Workflow management, entry status

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to set the workflow stage of an entry.

entry_id.description: Select an entry for which you want to set the workflow stage.

workflow_stage_uid.description: Select a workflow stage that needs to be set for the entry.

assigned_to.description: Select the assignee name(s) to let the user(s) know about the workflow update.

assigned_by_roles.description: Select the role(s) to send a notification to all the users with the selected role.

due_date.description: Enter the due date to update the workflow in ‘YYYY/MM/DD’ format.

comments.description: Enter a comment for the user to acknowledge the workflow update.

locale.description: Select a locale in which you want to set the entry workflow stage.

remove_localization.name: remove_localization
remove_localization.description: This tool removes the localized version of a specified entry in a given locale, restoring the entry to its original non-localized state within the selected branch and content type. Keywords: localization, revert.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to remove the localized version of the entry.

entry_id.description: Select an entry to restore to its original non-localized state.

locale.description: Select a locale (language) to remove the entry's localization in the selected locale. The entry must be localized in the selected locale.

unpublish_asset.name: unpublish_asset
unpublish_asset.description: This tool unpublishes a specified asset from selected environments and locales within a given branch, with optional scheduling for deferred execution.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

asset.description: Select an asset which you want to unpublish.

environments.description: Select an environment to unpublish the asset.

locales.description: Select the locale in which the asset should be unpublished.

scheduled_at.description: Schedule the asset unpublish in ‘YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS’ format.

unpublish_an_entry.name: unpublish_an_entry
unpublish_an_entry.description: This tool unpublishes a specified entry from selected environments and locales within a Contentstack stack branch, removing the entry from the CDN and making it inaccessible via delivery APIs. Keywords: unpublish, entry

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to unpublish the entry.

environments.description: Select the environment(s) from where you want to unpublish the entry.

locales.description: Select the locale(s) to unpublish the entry in that locale.

scheduled_at.description: When left blank, the unpublish schedule is set to "now." You may also enter a UTC time in "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format.

update_an_asset.name: update_an_asset
update_an_asset.description: This tool updates metadata or content of a single asset in a specified stack branch by asset ID, supporting modifications to title, description, file name, source URL, and folder assignment. Asset management, update.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

title.description: Specify a title for the asset.

description.description: Specify a description for the asset.

key.description: Specify a file name for the asset.

body.description: Specify an input URL to update an asset.

folder_id.description: Select a folder to update an asset in it.

update_an_entry.name: update_an_entry
update_an_entry.description: This tool updates a specified entry within a Contentstack stack by content type and entry ID, supporting branch and locale selection; entry data must be provided in the required object structure. Keywords: entry update, content type.

branch.description: Select a branch from your stack.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to update the entry.

entry_data.description: The fields should be wrapped by an entry object {'entry':{...data}}

locale.description: Select a locale in which the entry should be updated.

update_a_taxonomy.name: update_a_taxonomy
update_a_taxonomy.description: This tool updates the name and description fields of a specified taxonomy entity using its unique identifier. Keywords: taxonomy, update

name.description: Specify a title for the taxonomy.

description.description: Specify a description for the taxonomy.

update_a_term.name: update_a_term
update_a_term.description: This tool updates the name property of a specified term within a taxonomy using the provided taxonomy_uid and term_uid identifiers.

taxonomy_uid.description: Select a taxonomy to update the term.

name.description: Specify a title to update the term.

update_a_variant_of_an_entry.name: update_a_variant_of_an_entry
update_a_variant_of_an_entry.description: This tool updates the content fields of a specified entry variant within a Variant Group for a given content type, applying the provided changeset to the targeted entry in Contentstack. Keywords: entry update, variant group.

content_type_name.description: Select a content type to update the entry's variant.

entry_id.description: Select an entry to update its variant.

variant_group_uid.description: Select the Variant Group to update the variant.

variant_id.description: Select a variant to update its content.

entry_data.description: The fields should be wrapped by an entry object {'entry':{...data}}

changeset.description: Enter the change set data in JSON format to update the variant content.
